content: In 1924, which 'Great Gatsby' author spent time living in France during the era known as the Jazz Age?

F. Scott Fitzgerald, the author of "The Great Gatsby," spent time living in France during the Jazz Age in the 1920s. This period was characterized by cultural and artistic flourishing, and Fitzgerald was part of the expatriate community in Paris, often referred to as the "Lost Generation." His experiences during this time influenced his writing and perspective on the era.
